import React from 'react'; import { Form, FormInput, FormGroup, Button, Card, CardBody, CardTitle, Progress } from "shards-react"; import "./RecommendationsPage.css"; import MovieCard from '../components/MovieCard'; import { Table, Pagination, Select, Row, Col, Divider, } from 'antd' import { getFilteredMovieResults, getMovieSearch } from '../fetcher' import MenuBar from '../components/MenuBar'; const { Column, ColumnGroup } = Table; class MatchesPage extends React.Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.state = { genreQuery: "", languageQuery: "", releaseYearQuery: "", movieResults: [], selectedMovieId: window.location.search ? window.location.search.substring(1).split('=')[1] : 0, selectedMovieDetails: null, movieDetails: null } this.handleGenreQueryChange = this.handleGenreQueryChange.bind(this) this.handleLanguageQueryChange = this.handleLanguageQueryChange.bind(this) this.handleReleaseYearQueryChange = this.handleReleaseYearQueryChange.bind(this) this.updateSearchResults = this.updateSearchResults.bind(this) this.goToMatch = this.goToMatch.bind(this) } handleGenreQueryChange(event) { this.setState({ GenreQuery: event.target.value }) } handleLanguageQueryChange(event) { this.setState({ LanguageQuery: event.target.value }) } handleReleaseYearQueryChange(event) { // TASK 10: update state variables appropriately. See handleAwayQueryChange(event) for reference this.setState({ ReleaseYearQuery: event.target.value }) } goToMatch(matchId) { window.location = `/matches?id=${matchId}` } updateSearchResults() { //TASK 11: call getMatchSearch and update matchesResults in state. See componentDidMount() for a hint getFilteredMovieResults(this.state.genreQuery, this.state.languageQuery, this.state.releaseYearQuery, null, null).then(res => { this.setState({ matchesResults: res.results }) }) } componentDidMount() { getFilteredMovieResults(this.state.genreQuery, this.state.languageQuery, this.state.releaseYearQuery, null, null).then(res => { this.setState({movieDetails: res.results}) }) getMovieSearch(this.state.selectedMovieId).then(res => { this.setState({ selectedMovieDetails: res.results[0] }) }) } render() { return (

Find Your Favorite Movie!

if (!movieDetails){ console.log("MOVIE DEAILS: " + movieDetails),

{this.state.movieDetails.Title}

}
{/* TASK 12: Copy over your implementation of the matches table from the home page */} { return { onClick: event => {this.goToMatch(record.MovieId)}, // clicking a row takes the user to a detailed view of the match in the /matches page using the MatchId parameter }; }} dataSource={this.state.movieResults} pagination={{ pageSizeOptions:[5, 10], defaultPageSize: 5, showQuickJumper:true }}> {/* TASK 6: create two columns (independent - not in a column group) for the date and time. Do not add a sorting functionality */}
{this.state.selectedMovieDetails ?
{this.state.selectedovieDetails.title} {this.state.selectedMovieDetails.Date} at {this.state.selectedMatchDetails.Time} {/* TASK 13: Add a column with flex = 2, and text alignment = right to display the name of the away team - similar to column 1 in this row */} {this.state.selectedMovieDetails.Away}

{this.state.selectedMatchDetails.HomeGoals}

Goals {/* TASK 14: Add a column with span = 9, and text alignment = right to display the # of goals the away team scored - similar 1 in this row */}

{this.state.selectedMatchDetails.AwayGoals}

 {/* TASK 15: create a row for goals at half time similar to the row for 'Goals' above, but use h5 in place of h3! */}
{this.state.selectedMatchDetails.HTHomeGoals}
HTGoals
{this.state.selectedMatchDetails.HTAwayGoals}
 {this.state.selectedMatchDetails.ShotsOnTargetHome} / {this.state.selectedMatchDetails.ShotsHome} Shot Accuracy {/* TASK 18: add a progress bar to display the shot accuracy for the away team - look at the progress bar in column 1 of this row for reference*/} {this.state.selectedMatchDetails.ShotsOnTargetAway} / {this.state.selectedMatchDetails.ShotsAway}
{this.state.selectedMatchDetails.CornersHome}
Corners
{this.state.selectedMatchDetails.CornersAway}
 {/* TASK 16: add a row for fouls cards - check out the above lines for how we did it for corners */}
{this.state.selectedMatchDetails.FoulsHome}
Fouls
{this.state.selectedMatchDetails.FoulsAway}
{this.state.selectedMatchDetails.RCHome}
Red Cards

: null}
) } } export default MatchesPage
